item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S5098-5099; text as passed Senate: CR S5099; text of measure as introduced: CR S5093)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S5098-5099; text as passed Senate: CR S5099; text of measure as introduced: CR S5093)

summary.text: Commends the University of Connecticut Huskies women's basketball team for winning the 2003 National Collegiate Athletic Association Division I Women's Basketball Championship and for completing the 2002-2003 season with a record of 37 wins and one loss, including winning their record 70th game in a row.

(This measure has not been amended since being introduced in the Senate on April 9, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Commends the University of Connecticut Huskies women's basketball team for winning the 2003 National Collegiate Athletic Association Division I Women's Basketball Championship and for completing the 2002-2003 season with a record of 37 wins and one loss, including winning their record 70th game in a row.

bill.title: A resolution commending the Huskies of the University of Connecticut for winning the 2003 NCAA Division I Women's Basketball Championship.

item.title: A resolution commending the Huskies of the University of Connecticut for winning the 2003 NCAA Division I Women's Basketball Championship.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
